trans-unit.source: Provides information about a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell"></xref> to accessibility client applications.
Windows Forms includes built-in accessibility support that allows your application to work with accessibility client applications.

Examples of accessibility client applications include screen enlarger and reviewer utilities, voice input utilities, on-screen keyboards, alternative input devices, and keyboard enhancement utilities.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject> class inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> class to provide information about a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell> to accessibility client applications.

Each class that represents a visual part of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>—such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell>—also contains a class that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> to provide information about the containing class and perform actions on behalf of accessibility client applications.

There are instances when you will want to provide additional information, such as the name or description of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control, to accessibility client applications.
There are two ways of providing this additional information.

To provide limited accessibility information for existing controls, set the control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleName%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleDescription%2A> property values, which will be reported to accessibility client applications.

You should change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleDefaultActionDescription%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleRole%2A> property values only in rare situations, such as if you make a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> look like a list.

Occasionally, you might require more accessibility information or different accessibility actions to be included with your custom <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell>.

To customize accessibility, you can write your own class that derives from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewAccessibleObject> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> classes and override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method.

For example, if you are writing a custom row header cell that implements unique custom actions, such as special hit testing within your cell, you should create a class that inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject> class and override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> exposes its data structure by using <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole> values to define the data table hierarchy.

For more information on exposing data tables to Microsoft Active Accessibility, see "Exposing Data Tables through Microsoft Active Accessibility" in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref> class.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell"></xref> that owns the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
Gets the location and size of the accessible object.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the bounds of the accessible object.
Gets a string that describes the default action of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell> belongs to a column with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.SortMode%2A> property value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode.Automatic>, this property returns the string "Press to sort column".

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SelectionMode%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control has a value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode.FullColumnSelect> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode.ColumnHeaderSelect>, this property returns the string "Press to select column".
If neither of these conditions is present or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell> does not currently belong to a column, this property returns <xref:System.String.Empty>.
A string that describes the default action of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>
Performs the default action associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
The default action is indicated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.DefaultAction%2A> property.
Gets the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.

The name of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject> is the same as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.HeaderText%2A> property of the cell's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
Navigates to another accessible object.

The following table describes which <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell> owns the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> that is returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> method.
Parameter value
Description
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell> to the right of the current header cell.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell> to the left of the current header cell.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell> after the current header cell.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell> before the current header cell.
The first <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell>.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTopLeftHeaderCell> if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowHeadersVisible%2A> property is `true`.
The last <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell>.

The direction that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> method moves when you specify <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation.Next> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation.Previous> depends on whether the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> has right-to-left support enabled.

For example, if right-to-left support is enabled, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> will return the same accessible object when you specify <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation.Next> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation.Left>.

If right-to-left support is not enabled, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> will return the same object when you specify <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation.Next> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation.Right>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation"></xref> values.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> that represents an object in the specified direction.
Gets the parent of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
The parent of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
Gets the role of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole.RowHeader"></xref> value.
Modifies the column selection depending on the selection mode.
If the owning cell does not belong to a column, no action is taken.
Otherwise, the following table describes the action performed for each `flags` value.
Parameter value
Action

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control that contains the owning cell has a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SelectionMode%2A> property value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode.FullColumnSelect> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectionMode.ColumnHeaderSelect>, the column containing the cell is selected.
If the column containing the cell is selected, the selection is canceled.
All other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection> values
No action is taken.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection"></xref> values.
Gets the state of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.State%2A> property value always includes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Selectable> value.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.State%2A> includes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Selected> value if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn> that contains the cell is selected.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.State%2A> includes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Offscreen> value if the owning cell is not currently displayed.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Selectable"></xref>.
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is `null`.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.Value%2A> property is the same as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject.Name%2A> property.
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
